answers.answer: If it were me I would go where ever the delivery is comfortable and the doctor is good he is only around for so long but as long as he delivers the baby well and knows if there is something wrong that sound be all that matters. I am a nurse. Don't be afraid to stand up to the doctor if you have an issue with his bedside manner to make you feel comfortable.

I would keep the great doctor because you do not want to deal with a doctor with no bedside manners while laboring. If the staff at the hospital cause a problem ask to speak to the charge nurse or top administrator.
Just because ur friends and relatives have had a bad experience doesnt mean u will also have the same experience.
Its a hard decision since i really have to decide by latest next week. If i go back to the previous office that dr is always in a rush and doesnt return emergency calls for 3 hrs later!
How do you girls feel about sharing room and bathroom?? How bad is it? Or could it be?

Ive never shared a room when I had my other two kids but I dont think I would like it personally... I like my privacy. I actually picked my doctor based on the hospital he delivered at. It worked out well for me because I got a great doctor and I already know how this hospital is. Some doctors deliver at more than one hospital.. have you asked him if he delivers at any other hospitals as well?
If he only delivers at the one hospital then I say just stick with him anyway. Better to have a great doctor than one that doesnt care.

I would personally choose based on the hospital. Just because that doctor does not have the best bed side manner doesn't mean he isn't a good doctor. You will spend almost all your time with the nurses not the doctor. Plus, if you could avoid sharing a room I would. You never know who you will be roomed with. Good luck with which decision you make.
I would go with the better hospital.  The doc isn't in there long and I would rather have a better room and nurses.
I feel horrible sharin bathroom and room thats no privacy and im pretty sure i wont even close an eye

I would not want to share a room and bathroom with someone else. The doctor is only there to deliver the baby. The nurses will probably be the people you interact with the most. I would go with the better hospital with the better nurses. Is there any way you could find a new doctor that delivers at the hospital you like?
Unfortunately not and i tried to make an appt and next appt is jan 22 im due jan 29.
Does anyone know IF YOU CAN just go and deliver to the hospital you decide? Even if you havent seen any of the Drs that could be ther

I don't like the hospital either because they always make me stay in one position to birth the baby and they can be rude and pushy and the scrub tech was rudely staring at my vag lol ..but I have high risk pregnancies and I get preeclampsia and bleed a lot so I have no choice but to deliver at the hospital...or I might die. That's my only thing is safety.
Oh, I thought you were asking about birthing center or home birth vs hospital, sorry.

question: The Dr that i currently see delivers at a hospital that many of my relatives and friends have had a bad experience and now its really starting to get to me. My previous Dr who i had to switch had horrible bedside manner and would always rush and not cared.about my concerns BUT DELIVERS and a great hospital! I love my Dr his very caring with me but i dont know what to do ! Please advice. Where would you deliver? The hospital where im supposed to go shares a room and bathroom and the nurses are rude! So confused!
title: Where to deliver !? so confused
